trigger.pattern: A few brightly burning torches line the entrance to this cavern. The$floor is dirt and relatively level, giving good purchase and allowing one to$move confidently about. The air feels cool and dank upon your skin, a few$water droplets falling from stalactites above. A dark tunnel continues$north.

Not far from the entrance, the darkness quickly overtakes you. As you$move deeper into the cave, you can only see a few strides ahead of you at a$time. Feeling your way around the room you can find multiple exits though$each looks and feels the same. The only natural lighting in the room comes$from the entrance to the South.

Standing in the shallows, you are near the center of a massive cavern$illuminated by a soft light that seems to emanate from the distant walls. $The footing is a rough, black and red sand that forms a small place to rest$in the otherwise water-filled cavern.

The floor here is solid and a very dark red, but has the distinct texture$of pumice rock. The walls remain jagged and littered with pockets of$lichen. While small in circumference, this cave seems to have no ceiling,$instead rising straight up for what must be several stories.

The air shaft ends abruptly as it turns into a rounded, lava-bored$tunnel. The walls are beautifully striped in reds, browns, yellows, and$even some hints of purple, and the floor is nearly as concave as the walls. $There remains a fair breeze blowing eastward now through the tube.

An undulating tunnel$ The lava tube undulates as it rolls deeper into the mountain, its striped$walls twisting around you. The floor is slightly concave with irregular,$long-since solidified deposits of lava rock throughout the corridor, but$walking is not difficult. From here there are tunnels leading est and,$southeast. $Obvious exits: w se

An end to the tubes$ The relatively smooth walls of the lava tubes end abruptly here as the$tube turns upward into another ventilation shaft. The walls here are less$uniform and the striped coloration starts to fade back to varying shades of$reds and black. One may or may not be able to find purchase for climbing$here, but the only way out, aside from back through the lava tubes, is up. $ $Obvious exits: u ne

Atop a dormant volcano$ What was once a mountaintop is now a lop-sided crater, evidence of an$eruption long in the past. The crater walls are steep on one side and$nearly level with the ground on the other. Tiny bits of crumbled red and$black pumice rock litter the landscape, making for deep footing. A tunnel$can be seen at the base of the steeper wall of the crater.

Deafening dark$ The roar of a waterfall fills your ears and a drenching mist now$threatens to fill your lungs as well. Where you could see your outstretched$arm moments ago, now you can hardly see your hand held just in front of your$face. The noise is deafening to the point it could be coming from any$direction. $Obvious exits: n e s w nw ne sw se

The dark is really setting in now. The sound of water dripping echoes$quietly throughout the room. The dirt floor is rough and strewn with$pebbles that crunch softly beneath your feet. Humid air fills your lungs$and the smell of something rotting tingles at your nostrils.

The darkness here seems unnaturally dense. No amount of magic can light$the room much past your person. Shadows dance at the peripherals of your$vision, leading you to wonder if you're not alone. Pebbles at your feet$have given way to a rough-hewn stone floor which must be navigated with care$in the dark.

The skitter of feet across the stone floor catches your ears as you move$further into the darkness. The air is humid here and a faint draft drifts$through the room. Searching for exits, your only choice is to push forward$into darkness.

Just as you think you might be growing accustomed to the unnatural dark,$the sound of children laughing reaches your ears. It dissipates whenever$you turn to look in its direction only for someone to giggle behind your$back a moment later. It might be best to continue forward, whichever$direction that might be.

While the darkness does not seem to dissipate, the sound of dripping$water is muffled by what might be a steady flow of water somewhere beyond. $Touching the walls or boulders that intermittently block your path, your$hand would find only slick, wet stone.

The scent of mold touches your nose as you delve deeper into the caverns,$the way back to the entrance as unclear as your path forward. The sound of$the water, while still faint, seems to come from behind the rock that$surrounds you.

The darkness is disorienting, even to those most at home beneath the$earth. As you move forward, the visibility dwindles to the point you can no$longer see much beyond your nose. Regardless how you turn, nothing seems to$distinguish one direction from another.

The darkness is beginning to feel palpable, your vision limited to an$arm's length in front of you, fingers disappearing before your eyes. The$floor continues to be rough beneath your feet and the draft swirls around$the space, its origin unclear.

You can hear the water rushing now and it sounds close. The floor and$all surfaces of this room seem slick with algae and the draft through the$room now comes laden with mist that covers your clothing and skin and your$pretty confident something just slithered past your foot.

There is no struggle as your body crashes down with the cascade into a$deep body of water below. The force of the water pushes you ever downward$and tumbles your body end over end against your will for entirely too long. $Just as you think this could be the end, your body breaks free of the tumult$and into quieter water.
